articles.headline: ‘No Realistic Path’ for Quick Vote on $2,000 Stimulus Checks, McConnell Says
articles.snippet: The Senate leader all but ended any chance of increasing direct payments, despite some Republican support for the effort.
articles.abstract: The Senate leader all but ended any chance of increasing direct payments, despite some Republican support for the effort.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Mitch McConnell effectively killed off any chance that Congress would increase stimulus checks to $2,000 before President Trump leaves office, saying there was “no realistic path” for the Senate to pass a stand-alone bill.
